content.description: Big cobbles to blunt arete with hard to find pockets at the top.
content.protection: There are 9 bolts plus rap hanger anchors with quick links/chains.
content.location: Fifth route from the left.  First route on the overhanging face just left of the obvious break.

content.description: Another great route. Nice holds on pockets and cobbles.
content.location: far right hand side of the wall

content.description:
The route is an old abandoned route that was bolted several years ago.  I had left the route alone for several years because their was a red tag.  I took the red tag off last spring because it had turned white due to sun bleaching and no one had ever returned to give it any attention. I spent two full sessions cleaning the route. Their was A LOT of loose Rock. If you get off route you may still encounter some so I recommend a helmet for your belayer.

You get into the crux of the route about 8 feet up the wall and it doesn't let up until you have clipped the 4th bolt(25 ft). The crux requires powerful committing moves on small but mostly positive holds (V6ish).  After pulling the roof you find an awkward but decent place to catch a shake. Continue through a few  more bolts of good 5.11 climbing (35+ feet). Last 15 ft of the route is a bit disappointing as the route was bolted with the idea of creating a 3 pitch route. So the climbing turns into a 5.9 traverse to the anchors. I recommend back cleaning the traverse after sending, then lowering off a carabiner.

I tried to make the description detailed so anyone can come prepared.  So if it sounds a bit intense its really not too bad. The route climbs well and is well worth the effort.

The upper pitches need a lot of cleaning and probably an additional bolt or two.  I am unable to dedicate the time into tackling such a large project. I was pleased to have freed the first pitch. If someone takes the time to clean the upper pitches it would make for a great and difficult multi-pitch route.
content.location: the route is found in the cave located on the far west side of the formation. Hike up the trail to access the main group of routes then traverse the cliff until just before rounding the far corner. You will see a cave above a class 4 scramble. Their are 2 routes, this route is the one on the right.

content.description: big cobble stones and pockets to a shared last bolt and anchor.
content.protection: 5 bolts (top bolt shared with No More Mr Nice Guy 5.10d) plus 2 rap hangers for anchors
content.location: first route from the right side of Shinobe proper.

content.description: One committing move at the middle of the climb.
content.location: far right hand side of the wall

content.description: Steep cobbles with big reaches to thin technical pockets at top.  Probably the best route on the crag.
Vertical pockets lead to lower angle before last steep pull to anchors.
content.location: Just Right of the obvious break in the cliff with all the steeper routes to the left.

content.description: Steep pockets to reachy cobbles.  Fun.
content.protection: here are 5 bolts plus rap hanger anchors with quick links/chains
content.location: On left side of the smaller round buttress with the majority of the routes.

content.protection: There are 6 bolts plus rap hanger anchors with quick links/chains.
content.location: Just to the right of Detachment.

content.description: Big steep cobbles to a rest then some loose rock leads to nice pockets in water channel at the top.
content.protection: There are 8 bolts plus rap hanger anchors with quick links/chains.
content.location: Seventh route from the right.  In middle of overhanging face.

content.description: This is a great route on pockets and cobbles up a vertical wall. 5 bolts to rap anchor.
content.location: far right hand side of the wall.

content.description: Deceptively steep line running on both sides of the arete with good cobbles and pockets.
content.protection: 4 bolts plus rap hangers for anchors
content.location: Traverse left across the scree slope from the 9 routes that make up the main wall of Shinobe. Located on the middle island of rock leaning on the tallest one to the right of it.
